item.title: 2023: The South Will Square Up With The North To Produce The Next Nigerian President
item.description: Former Interim National Chairman of the All Progressives Congress (APC), Chief Bisi Akande has said the south will not just lie low and get trampled in the race to the 2023 presidency. Ahead of the 2023 presidential election, the debates have continued among Nigerians on the legality and desirability of zoning the presidency to a particular region. Some stakeholders are of the opinion that it is the turn of the south to produce Nigeria’s next president after President Muhammadu Buhari’s tenure ends in 2023 but some others are of the opinion that zoning is non-constitutional and should not be enforced as the best candidate should be allowed to emerge.

item.description: A viral TikTok showing a woman signing her boyfriend's "permission slip" for a boy's night out started a viral debate on TikTok. Source: TikTok | @talgonzaThe dynamics of romantic relationships between men and women have been the subject of artistic contention across pretty much every medium imaginable. Songs have been written about the struggles between men and women. Stand-up comedy sets, movies, novels, heck even drug store holiday cards all discuss this phenomenon.

item.title: Your Threats 'Unnecessary' - Buhari Replies Niger Delta Avengers
item.description: President Muhammadu Buhari on Sunday reacted to threats by the Niger Delta Avengers to attack oil installations in the south-south region. In a statement to newsmen through his Special Adviser on Media, Femi Adesina, Buhari described the threats as “unnecessary”. Buhari noted that the issues raised by the group had been responded to when he met with the leadership of the Niger Delta and Ijaw National Congress (INC), at the Presidential Villa on Friday.

item.title: Why I Will Never Be Full-Time Housewife BBNaija's Doyin
item.description: Big Brother Naija reality show star Doyinsola Anuoluwapo David, known as Doyin, has disclosed the reason behind her decision to refrain from becoming a full-time homemaker in the event of marriage. Her stance revolves around the apprehension that her partner might undergo a transformation and cease providing for her and their children, thus prompting her reluctance to embrace the role of a traditional “housewife.” Delivering her perspective through a video message posted on her Instastory, Doyin asserted that men tend to hold greater respect for a wife who maintains financial independence compared to one who assumes the role of a conventional housewife.

item.title: Tinubu Reveals Reason He Chose Shettima As His Running Mate
item.description: The presidential candidate of the All Progressives Congress (APC), Bola Tinubu, has explained why he chose the former Governor of Borno State, Kashim Shettima, as his running mate for the 2023 presidential election. Speaking during a meeting with the leadership of the Christian Association of Nigeria (CAN) in Abuja on Wednesday, Tinubu said his choice of Shettima as his running mate was strategic, not religious. The APC Presidential candidate said he chose Shettima due to the urgent need to address the challenges facing the country, adding that he wanted a progressive government.

item.title: 8 Top benefits of eating raw onions every day explained
item.description: How useful is eating onions 7 days a week? What are the benefits of eating raw onions every day? Let us explore the magic advantages of this vegetable. You will be impressed by how useful it is for your body. Eating raw onionsOnion is a popular vegetable all over the world. It grows all year round, and it is a flavour element for most dishes. Nigerians, for example, love to add white, green, yellow and red onions to their dishes because this vegetable adds a unique flavour and makes you healthier.

The event was nothing short of perfect and the decor was just heavenly. It was like a modern day fairy tale. item.title: My Husband Does Not Make A Decision Without Asking Me First
item.description: Controversial Nollywood actress, Anita Joseph has shared her secret to a happy home. The Anambra State-born thespian, while speaking via Instagram, explained how her husband, Michael Olagunju aka MC Fish treats her. She revealed that her husband does not make a decision without asking her first, noting that he seeks her opinion in everything. Anita explained that she also reciprocates the action and seeks his permission and opinion on issues. The mother of one opined that adopting that kind of mindset is one of the secret to a happy home.

item.title: National CAN Tackles Kwara State Governor Abdulrahman Abdulrazaq
item.description: The National leadership of the Christian Association of Nigeria (CAN) has called out the Kwara State Governor, Abdulrahman Abdulrazaq over the recent policy by his administration on the wearing of hijab by female students in public schools. The State government had recently ordered that all Muslim female students in public schools including Christian grant-aided schools in the state must be allowed to wear hijab as part of their uniforms. The directive has however generated a lot of controversies with the Christian body in the state including the proprietors of such grant-aided schools firmly rejecting the position of the state government.

item.title: Ay Makun And Mabel Unfollow Each Other On IG As She Visits Police Station, Alleges Threat To Life
item.description: Popular Nigerian comedian AY Makun and his wife, Mabel Makun have unfollowed each other on Instagram. This is coming hours after Mabel announced that her life was being threatened by an unnamed individual. The mum of two also said she has been mentally abused for a long time and has had enough. She wrote, “The threat to my life is actually getting out of hand, and if anything happens to me, there’ is just one person to be held responsible.

item.title: Gunmen Kill Eight Month Old Baby, Seven Others In Plateau
item.description: In a recent attack on the village of Farin Lamba in the Vwang area of Jos South LGA, Plateau, gunmen reportedly killed eight people, among them an eight-month-old baby. The attack occurred Sunday night, as per Rwang Tengwong, the national publicity secretary of the Berom Youth Movement, a socio-cultural group. Tengwong provided details about the incident, stating, “The gunmen invaded the village at about 9:45 p.m. on Sunday in a car and shot sporadically at the victims.

item.title: Is Dont Look Up About COVID? Not Really, but It Could Be
item.description: ‘Don’t Look Up’ Is Basically About How Collectively Stupid Society IsBy Mustafa GatollariPublished Dec. 27 2021, 1:11 a.m. ET Source: NetflixYou can never really underestimate a human being's capacity for stupidity and blatant willingness to completely ignore evidence. Adam McKay's latest Netflix feature, Don't Look Up, starring Leonardo DiCaprio, Meryl Streep, Jennifer Lawrence, Timothee Chalamet, Cate Blanchett, and Tyler Perry is basically about this very real human phenomenon. And there are a lot of folks who think it might also be about COVID.

item.title: Senate President, Lawan Denies Sitting On Letters Of Defection
item.description: The Senate President, Ahmad Lawan on Saturday denied sitting on letters of some senators planning to dump the All Progressives Congress. Lawan in his reaction to some claims on some platforms noted that there is no letter of defection before him. He further stated that the people behind the claim have not taken out time to confirm from the affected senators, if and when the letter was submitted to the Senate President.

item.title: Tinubu's Candidacy Illegal, Null And Void
item.description: The main opposition party, Peoples Democratic Party (PDP), has described the sponsorship of the presidential candidate of the All Progressives Congress (APC), Bola Tinubu, as illegal, which was voided by the 2022 Electoral Act. Naija News reports that the PDP made this known on Saturday through its National Publicity Secretary, Debo Ologunagba. Recall that a Federal High Court had nullified the nomination of Governor Gboyega Oyetola of Osun State as the governorship candidate of the APC in the July 16, 2022 election.

item.title: BuyPower: learn how to pay your electricity bills online
item.description: BuyPower makes it possible for anyone to buy power conveniently. Sometime back, it would require hours of standing in long queues to pay your monthly electricity bill, but that is not the case today. The process has been simplified and can be done at the comfort of your home or office. Buy Power.ng, which is what BuyPower is often referred to, is a utility payment platform allowing customers to conveniently buy electricity and recharge their prepaid meter online.

item.title: PDP Presidential Candidate, Atiku Raises Team To Woo Wike
item.description: The presidential candidate of the Peoples Democratic Party, Atiku Abubakar has set up a committee to reach out to the Governor of Rivers State, Nyesom Wike and other aggrieved members of the party. Governor Wike has remained silent since the former Vice President decided to pick the Governor of Delta State, Ifeanyi Okowa as his running mate. Atiku in his plan to win the 2023 presidential election set up the committee to woo the aggrieved members to come on board.

item.title: Where Is 'The Dating Game' Killer Now? He Was Convicted in 1980
item.description: 'The Dating Game' Killer Was Active for Almost 10 Years Before He Was CaughtBy Chrissy BobicPublished Jan. 8 2021, 12:29 p.m. ET Source: YouTubeRodney Alcala, who would later be known as The Dating Game Killer for his one-time appearance on the TV show, committed his first known crime in 1968 when he was discovered luring an 8-year-old girl into his apartment. The police found her alive but beaten and raped, and Alcala fled.

item.title: President Tinubu Set To Forward Minister Nominees Names To Senate
item.description: As lawmakers prepare to return from their Sallah break, signs suggest that President Bola Tinubu might send his ministerial nominees’ list to the National Assembly this week. The 10th Senate and House of Representatives will resume their duties on July 4, following their recess. It is expected that the ministerial list may be a top agenda item upon their return. Since President Tinubu took office on May 29, there’s been considerable speculation and heated debates about who would make the cut for the ministerial positions.

item.title: 22 Images That'll Give You Bad Luck Just By Looking At Them
item.description: 22 Images That'll Give You Bad Luck Just By Looking At Them I grew up in a marginally superstitious family who brought some beliefs and hocus-pocus superstitions from the old country. I couldn't make too much noise late at night for fear of attracting a "jinn." I couldn't point at cemeteries or stare into a mirror for too long or my face would become deformed, and heaven help me if I was ever mean to or disobeyed my parents or grandparents, because then I'd be looking at a cursed life that would ruin me until the day that I died.

Access Bank customer care tries to solve their customers' problems, and here is everything you need to know about how to contact its representatives. Access Bank is currently one of the largest and most popular financial institutions in Nigeria.

item.title: APC Postpones Screening Of Presidential Aspirants
item.description: The ruling All Progressives Congress has shifted the screening of the twenty-eight presidential aspirants who have submitted their nomination forms to the 23rd of May. The party shifted the screening following the decision of some presidential aspirants to withdraw from the presidential race. According to the APC, the party would screen the remaining presidential aspirants on the 23rd of this month. The development was confirmed in a statement released by the National Organising Secretary of the party, Sulaiman Argungu, on Saturday.

item.title: Fuel Subsidy A Major Setback To Human Development In Nigeria
item.description: The Nigerian government has been admonished to divert money spent on fuel subsidies into other sectors that will profit the country. The World Bank observed in its latest report that the money splashed on fuel subsidies in Nigeria has surpassed the government’s spending on health, education and social protection for Nigerians. Naija News understands that Nigeria’s petrol subsidy as of 2021 cost around $4.5bn, or roughly two per cent of GDP.

item.title: PDP BoT Doing Its Best To Resolve Lingering Crisis
item.description: A former Minister of Women Affairs, Inna Ciroma, has said the Board of Trustees (BoT) of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) is doing its best to resolve the lingering crisis in the party. Naija News reports that the main opposition party had been battling with issues between its presidential candidate, Atiku Abubakar and Governor Nyesom Wike of Rivers State. The rift between the duo began after Atiku won the PDP Presidential primaries and picked Delta State Governor, Ifeanyi Okowa, as his running mate.

According to the communique, the support groups asked the APC Presidential candidate, Bola Tinubu, to choose a young running mate in the person of a party chieftain, Ibrahim Bello Dauda.

item.title: BREAKING: Tribunal Orders For Re-run In Akwa Ibom Gov Poll
item.description: An uneasy calm enveloped the residents of Uyo today, October 21, following  the final verdict which was passed concerning the petition against the Akwa Ibom state governor, Udom Gabriel Emmanuel, at the state governorship election tribunal. The tribunal ordered for a rerun of the governorship election in the state, Vanguard reports. The Justice Sadiq Umar-led tribunal sitting in Abuja ordered the Independent National Electoral Commission to conduct re-run election in 18 local government areas of the state.

It is the precision, prestige and the diversified culture that is in-born in every African designer that makes their Kitenge designs impressive.

item.title: NNPC Worth N50trn, Can Be Listed On Stock Exchange ECOWAS Don
item.description: The assets of the National Petroleum Corporation (NNPC) have been valued by Economic Strategist to the Economic Community of West African States, Ken Ife at N50 trillion. According to Ife, NNPC can be listed on the Nigerian Exchange Limited. Ife while speaking at a Growth Initiatives for Fiscal Transparency, GIFT, dialogue held in Abuja on Wednesday said the N50tn valuation includes the crude, gas, landed and intangible assets of NNPC Ltd.

item.title: NFF Addresses All States' FAs In Nigeria Over 2024 Federation Cup
item.description: The Nigeria Football Federation (NFF) has given the 36 Football Associations and the Federal Capital Territory, Abuja, a deadline for the completion of the states’ Federation Cup campaign. Most states across the country started their Federation Cup campaign on March 1, 2024, which is believed to be behind schedule. Hence, the NFF has mandated the states’ FA to complete their FA Cup games on either Saturday, March 30, or Sunday, March 31, 2024.

item.title: Anita Oyakhilomes biography: age, career, where is she now?
item.description: Anita Oyakhilome, also known as Anita Schafer, is a counsellor and ex-wife of Pastor Chris Oyakhilome, the founder and president of Christ Embassy, aka Believer's Loveworld. The two were married in 1991 and had two children together. Their marriage faced challenges, and they officially divorced in 2016. Anita is currently working as a counsellor and an integrated life solution therapist. She incorporates a combination of therapy types in her practice. Her work is counselling and helping people dealing with stress, abuse, grief, anxiety, depression, low self-esteem, loneliness, trauma, and lack of energy or motivation.

item.title: FG To Begin Trial of 800 Suspected Boko Haram Terrorists
item.description: The Federal Government is set to commence the trial of 800 suspected Boko Haram members. The Deputy Director, Prosecution and Head of Complex Casework Group, Federal Ministry of Justice, Chioma Onuegbu, stated this in Abuja on Friday during a media engagement on networking for justice and accountability. She added that out of 1,000 case files reviewed, 280 had been filed at the Federal High Court, while 170 were recommended for release for lack of evidence.

item.title: Buhari Sends Troops To Rescue Kagara Students
item.description: President Muhammadu has deployed troops and police to rescue students and staff of the Federal Government Science College in Kagara, Niger State who were abducted by gunmen. He instructed them to make sure that the students and other hostages were rescued without delay. “After receiving the report, President Buhari instructed the military and police to ensure that all hostages are rescued as soon as possible. “He has also deployed senior security officials to Niger State where they will meet state government officials, community leaders as well as parents of students and staff of the college,” the presidency said.

item.title: Edeoga Confirms He Is Now Enugu Labour Party Guber Candidate
item.description: The immediate past Commissioner of Environment in Enugu State, Hon. Chijioke Edeoga has announced he is now the governorship candidate for Enugu State Labour Party. Naija News understands that there has been rumours of the politician dumping the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) after losing in the party’s primary election a month ago. Speaking with Daily Post on Sunday, Edeoga said he is now the Labour Party governorship candidate in the State for the 2023 elections.

item.title: NDLEA Arrests Woman With cocaine Hidden In Private Part
item.description: The National Drug Law Enforcement Agency (NDLEA) has arrested a Nigerian based in Brazil, Anita Ogbonna, for concealing 100 pellets of cocaine in her private part and handbag. In a statement on Sunday by the agency’s spokesman, Femi Babafemi, the NDLEA said 12 wraps of cocaine inserted in her private part were extracted, while another 88 pellets stuffed in socks were discovered hidden in her handbag. Babafemi said Ogbonna was arrested at the Nnamdi Azikiwe International Airport, Abuja, on her arrival from Sao Paulo, Brazil via Doha in Qatar, on Friday.

item.title: Zelensky Reveals Who Can Stop Russia
item.description: President of Ukraine, Volodymyr Zelensky has called on Europe to wake up and take immediate action as they are the only ones capable of stopping Russia. Zelensky stated this on Friday while revealing Russia’s shelling at Ukraine nuclear power plant overnight. He called on Europe to make a move as this could mean the end of Europe. The station which was attacked by Russia is the largest nuclear station in Europe.

Boko Haram Training Camps Found in Mali: "Over 200 Nigerians Trained for 10 Months in Timbuktu"
item.description: Hundreds of Boko Haram members stayed at training camps with Malian militants for months in Timbuktu, learning to fix Kalashnikovs and launch shoulder-fired weapons, a report has said. The Nigerians fled the city into the desert, along with the other militants, days before a French airstrike on January 20. A man who said he was hired to cook for the militants said the Boko Haram members trained for about 10 months at what is now a bombed-out customs-police building on Timbuktu’s desert fringe, intermingling with a local al Qaeda offshoot called Ansar Dine.

item.title: OPEC Increases Nigeria's Oil Output To 1.829 Mb/d
item.description: The Organisation of Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC) and non-OPEC Ministers have increased Nigeria’s oil output to 1.829 million barrels per day (mb/d). The decision was taken at the just-concluded 19th OPEC and non-OPEC Ministerial Meeting, ONOMM, held via videoconference on Sunday. According to Vanguard, the new quota, which showed an increase of 30.6 per cent, when compared to the 1.4 mb/d, excluding condensate, currently being produced by Nigeria, will take effect from 2022.

item.title: December 25 Horoscope and Zodiac
item.description: Your sign's planetary ruler is Saturn and as you were born in the first Decan, or part, of the sign, your ruling planet has twice as much influence over your personalty. Being the planet of control, Saturn's influence is reflected in your discipline, determination, patience and organization. In friendships and love, you are extremely devoted, as you are motivated by the idea of bringing security to your loved ones. While you are quick to spoil those you hold dear, it may be surprising for you to realize that you value respect over all other forms of love or affection.

item.description: How many 'Avatar' movies will there be? Several sequels have been greenlit throughout the years, but the second film came out in 2022. Source: Getty ImagesIt's difficult to understate the impact that Avatar had when it was first released in 2009. Its use of expensive and detailed CGI paved the way for a new (and somewhat divisive) age of digital cinematic storytelling. To this day, Avatar remains one of the highest-grossing films of all time, rivaled only by 2019's Avengers: Endgame and 1939's Gone With the Wind.

item.title: Emefiele Should Not Be Made Scapegoat For Buhari's Sins
item.description: Former presidential aide, Reno Omokri has reacted to the arrest of the embattled suspended Governor of the Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN), Godwin Emefiele. The controversial author who opined that the CBN governor’s suspension appears to be a vindictive act, stressed that Emefiele should not be made a scapegoat for the sins of former Nigeria president, Muhammadu Buhari. Reno further stated that it is unfair to handcuff the former CBN governor whilst Buhari and the former governor of Kaduna, Nasir El Rufai are free men.

item.title: Part Of The 2023 Budget Can Still Be Altered Before Friday Presentation
item.description: The Special Adviser to the President on Media and Publicity, Femi Adesina, has revealed that part of the 2023 proposed N19.76 trillion budget can still be altered by Federal Executive Council (FEC) before Friday. This development comes after today’s FEC meeting which was presided over by President Muhammadu Buhari. The Presidential aide who briefed State House correspondents on the outcome of the meeting said FEC members discussed the proposed budget extensively, and part of its provisions including the revised 2023-2025 fiscal framework, expenditure profile, budget proposal, capital and aggregate expenditure, overhead cost and personnel cost among others can still be altered before the final approved copy is presented on Friday.

item.title: Woman Bails on Date After He Asks Her to Hold His Drink

It's enough sometimes to make folks want to swear off on trying to meet new people altogether, especially if you're not a fan of going out on a date, to begin with as you sit across from someone who can't read a room and won't stop talking about all the wild stuff they did with their friends in college, or, if you're out to dinner with them and the expectation is that you're the one footing the bill, you watch them greedily try and milk that free dinner for all its worth.

item.title: Olubadan Of Ibadan Buried Admist Tears [Photos]
item.description: The Olubadan of Ibadan, Saliu Adetunji, has finally been buried according to Islamic rites. Naija News had earlier reported that Oba Adetunji died on Sunday at the University College Hospital (UCH) Ibadan, after a brief illness. The late monarch was buried inside his Popoyemoja palace in Ibadan around 4pm on Sunday with sons and daughters of Ibadan attending the burial. The Chief Imam of Ibadanland, AbdulGaniyu Agbotomokekere, led prayers during the burial of the late traditional ruler.

item.title: Eric Clapton - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: Musician, singer, and songwriter who is widely considered one of the greatest guitarists of all time. He was a member of The Yardbirds, Derek and the Dominos, and Cream, and also found success as a solo artist. Before Fame His family deceived him as a child, leading him to believe that his mother was his older sister and his grandmother was his mother. Trivia He got the nickname Slowhand because he played the guitar with such ferocity that his strings would break and as he replaced them onstage, the audience would slowly clap their hands.

item.title: Mass Failure At Nigerian Law School
item.description: The Nigerian Law School recently released the 2013/2014 August result, and about 4,000 students were said to have failed the examination which is a prerequisite for them to be called to Bar. The students who paid over N300, 000 for the one year programme are angry and frustrated, blaming the their failure on the Director General of Nigerian Law School, Olarenwaju Adesola Onadeko, PM News reports. They claimed that Onadeko wants to destroy their career by failing them en masse and they have called for a review of the examination as well as their results.

item.title: Terrorists In Korea Target Americans, Mistakenly Bomb Themselves
item.description: Terrorists in Korea target Americans, but mistakenly fire bomb a Korean own English academy. Inspectors dispatched to a building in Suseong District, Daegu, where two anti-U.S. arsonists mistakenly attacked a cram school called the American Cultural Center yesterday, gather evidence At 7:07 a.m. before yesterday, an explosion went off on the third floor of a nine-story building in Suseong District, Daegu, starting a fire. Two arsonists had gotten access to the floor and hurled glass bottles filled with flammable liquids.

item.title: These are the last words of Lt Col Ali before he was killed
item.description: Fresh revelations have emerged on the last words of Lt. Col. Muhammad Abu Ali to his soldiers before he was killed by Boko Haram insurgents. Col. Abu Ali, who was the Commanding Officer, 272 Task Force Battalion at Mallam Fatori in Northern Borno, was killed in an ambush by Boko Haram terrorists, alongside four other soldiers on Friday, November 4. Ali, a recipient of the Chief of Army Staff Award for exceptional bravery and excellence, led the army units that recovered Gamboru-Ngala, Baga and several communities from the terrorists.

item.title: World Bank Gives Nigeria $700m For Landscapes Project
item.description: The World Bank says it has disbursed $700m to Nigeria from $31.7bn as climate financing in its 2022 fiscal year. Naija News reports that the bank made this known in a report on its website titled, ‘World Bank Group Exceeds New Climate Finance Target – $31.7 Billion in Funding for Climate Action.’ The global bank said it gave Nigeria the fund for an Agro-Climatic Resilience in Semi-Arid Landscapes Project that hopes to develop 20 watershed management plans covering the northern region.

item.title: Buhari Govt Shut Down Okash, GoCash, Other Online Banks [Full List]
item.description: The Muhammadu Buhari-led government has shut down some illegal financial institutions operating in some parts of Lagos State. Naija News reports that the illegal financial institutions were shut down following customers’ complaints of malpractices and invasion of privacy. In a chat with reporters on Friday, the Chief Executive Officer, Federal Competition Consumer Protection Commission (FCCPC), Babatunde Irukera, said the illegal online banks were situated in Opebi Road, Ikeja area of Lagos.

item.title: Sunday Igboho Meets Lawyers In Benin Republic
item.description: Yoruba Nation activist, Sunday Adeyemo, better known as Sunday Igboho, has met with his lawyers in Cotonou, Benin Republic. Naija News gathered that Igboho met with his legal team on Friday over his court case in the French-speaking country. Present at the meeting was the leader of Ilana Omo Oodua Worldwide, Professor Banji Akintoye and the Deputy leader of Ilana Omo Oodua Worldwide, Professor Wale Adeniran. Naija News recalls that Igboho was conditionally released from Cotonou prison on March 7 after spending over two hundred days in detention on the accusation of criminal association.

item.title: Top Nollywood Actor Kenneth Okonkwo Joins Politics
item.description: Popular Nollywood actor, Kenneth Okonkwo has joined the long list of Nigerian entertainers venturing into politics. Kenneth Okonkwo has declared his intention to represent the people of Nsukka/Igboeze South Federal Constituency in the National Assembly under the platform of the ruling party, People’s Democratic Party (PDP).  Speaking on his decision to contest in the forth coming elections he spoke to Encomium saying: “Having consulted extensively my people from the ward to the local government level, because I am a grassroots man and having secured their approval to launch my campaign, I started thinking of the best channel to tell the world"

item.title: Who Is the New Queen of England Following Queen Elizabeth II's Death?
item.description: Who Is the New Queen of England Following Queen Elizabeth II's Death?By Joseph AllenPublished Sept. 9 2022, 10:26 a.m. ET Source: Getty ImagesThe news of Queen Elizabeth II's death after 70 years on the throne has left many shocked, and has also made some confused about what the future of the British Royal Family will look like. Prince Charles, who has been waiting to ascend to the throne for his entire life, finally became King when his mother died, but many are confused about who will become the country's next queen.

Walker became a football star from his childhood club, Sheffield United, to Tottenham Hotspur and Manchester City. Despite being together with Annie since he was a teenager, the 33-year-old fullback has been unable to stay away from other ladies.

item.title: PDP Presidential Candidate, Atiku Makes Demand From INEC Ahead 2023 Election
item.description: The Presidential candidate of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP), Atiku Abubakar, on Thursday admitted that there has been significant improvement in the way elections are conducted in Nigeria recently. While commending the Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) for a job well done, the former vice president urged the electoral body to ensure a credible, free and fair process in the conduct of the forthcoming 2023 general elections. Naija News reports that Atiku made the request in a statement issued today through his Media Adviser, Paul Ibe, to mark the International Day for Democracy (IDD).

The anniversary of any wedding is an important celebration where you can sometimes invite friends and relatives. item.title: "I'm Now Perfectly Okay" Victony Speaks On Fatal Accident That Placed Him In A Wheel Chair
item.description: Sensational Nigerian singer, Anthony Victor popularly known as Victony has revealed that he had his last surgery in January this year. Naija News recalls that the singer, in 2021 was involved in a fatal accident that left one dead and three injured. The accident put him in a wheelchair for about a year. Speaking on the dire incident in a recent interview with Tacha on Cool FM in Lagos, the singer who is now back on his feet, said he is perfectly okay after his last surgery.

item.title: Chris Paul (Basketball Player) - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: Star NBA point guard and 2006 Rookie of the Year whose nickname is CP3. He led the NBA in assists in 2008 and 2009 while playing for the New Orleans Hornets. He played for the Los Angeles Clippers from 2011 to 2017 before a trade sent him to the Houston Rockets. In 2020, he joined the Phoenix Suns. Before Fame He won a number of national AAU basketball titles before attending Wake Forest University. After two years of college basketball, he was selected 4th overall by the Hornets in the 2005 NBA Draft.

item.description: A brother to the leader of the proscribed Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB), Nnamdi Kanu, has narrated how they lost contact with the IPOB leader after he went “missing.” Speaking to The UK Guardian, Kingsley Kanu stated that the pro-Biafra activist was abducted when he took a walk on the streets of Kenya. Kanu’s brother, Kingsley, said he had spoken with him while he was in Kenya, “days before he went missing in June.

item.title: FG Targets N23bn In Onitsha River Port Concession
item.description: The Federal Government hopes to earn N23 billion from the N4 billion concession of the Onitsha River Port in Anambra State under a public-private partnership arrangement. The Minister of State for Transportation, Gbemisola Saraki, stated this in her address at the signing ceremony of the partnership arrangement at the headquarters of the Federal Ministry of Transportation in Abuja. She added that the concession deal which is for 30 years was agreed upon after about five years of discussions on the concession of the facility.

item.title: Guy Finds a Cat and Her Kittens Under His Bed and It's Life Changing
item.description: This Guy Found A Cat And Her Kittens Under His Bed And His Whole Life ChangedBy Aimee LutkinUpdated Oct. 12 2018, 3:44 p.m. ET Cat lovers know what gifts from above their furry jerks are. It's hard to be too sad when you have an animal rubbing its head on your ankles and then biting them. My cat always cheers me up, or at the very least, makes me get out of bed to feed them—and once you're out of bed, you might as well continue on with the day!

She also plays the villain Fish Mooney in the FOX drama series Gotham and she was cast in the 2015 film Magic Mike XXL.  Before Fame In 1989, she graduated from the Baltimore School for the Arts, majoring in Theater and Dance. Falegan had called Nkechi’s personal hygiene into question, accusing her of not changing her underpants for days. This was followed by a comeback from Nkechi stating that she does not wear underpants.

item.title: Nnamdi Kanu's IPOB Makes Strong Allegation Against British Govt
item.description: The Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) led by Nnamdi Kanu, has accused the British government of masterminding all the discriminatory activities against Biafrans. Naija News reports that the IPOB made this comment in a statement issued by its Media and Publicity Secretary, Emma Powerful, entitled “The deliberate and well-orchestrated destruction of Biafra and Igbo race, in particular, was started by the British government”, The pro-Biafra group also alleged that the British government classified certain parts of Igboland as sub-Igbo groups, including Ngwa, Opobo, Bonny to achieve their selfish aims, when they never had such classification as sub-Yoruba or sub-Hausa groups.

item.title: TikTok Star Mads Lewis Issues an Apology After She Is Accused of Blackfishing
item.description: TikTok star Mads Lewis is accused by fans of blackfishing after posting recent photos. Following the backlash, the teen issued an apology. Source: instagramAnother day, more social media drama. TikTok star Mads Lewis currently boasts more than 10 million followers on the viral Gen Z app. But, most recently, the influencer was called out by her fans for blackfishing. The term has been used to describe non-Black people altering their appearance by using photo editing tools, bronzer, or sometimes surgery to appear Black.

item.title: Nigerias 1999 Constitution A Fraud, Military Imposition Pastor Bakare
item.description: Nigeria 1999 constitution has been described by the General-Overseer of the Citadel Global Community Church, Pastor Tunde Bakare, as a fraud. The cleric while speaking in Lagos in commemoration of the June 12 Democracy Day said the 1999 constitution is inconsistent and a military imposition. He said: “You see all this trying to tinker with the constitution; I am just laughing because in the process, let me just restrain myself there because I don’t want others to think their effort is not appreciated.

item.title: Top Nigerian Newspaper Headlines For Today, Friday, 26th January, 2024
item.description: Good morning Nigeria. Welcome to the Naija News roundup of top newspaper headlines in Nigeria for today, Friday, 26th January 2024. The Bola Tinibu government has promised to hold talks with the Organised Labour over a new minimum wage in March. The Minister of Information and National Orientation, Mohammed Idris, made this known on Thursday in Abuja, while speaking at a dialogue organised by the Media Trust Group. Idris said when President Bola Tinubu removed fuel subsidy, the administration initially proposed paying N25,000 wage award to workers to cushion the effect of the policy.

item.title: 2023: More Than 50% Of New Voters Want Their PVCs Because Of Peter Obi
item.description: The National Publicity Secretary of the Labour Party, Abayomi Arabambi has submitted that the increase in the number of Nigerians clamouring to get their Permanent Voter Cards (PVCs) ahead of the 2023 elections is because they want to support the Peter Obi presidential ambition. He claimed more than 50% of the new voters registered are those who believe in Peter Obi. Arabambi added that the presidential ambition of the Labour Party (LP) candidate has awoken a fresh interest of Nigerians in the electoral process, particularly the youths of the country.

item.title: 2023: It Is Going To Be Another Kiriji War
item.description: Some Yoruba groups, 121 in number have converged in Lagos under what they called ‘The 2023 Declaration’ to decide on which presidential candidate to support. Naija News reports that the front runners for the 2023 general elections are Labour Party (LP), Peter Obi, All Progressives Congress (APC), Bola Ahmed Tinubu and Peoples Democratic (PDP), Atiku Abubakar. An influential group from the southwest, Afenifere has pledged their support to the  LP flag bearer on the basis that the South-West has produced the president before and currently has someone from the zone occupying the Vice president’s office whereas the South-East has never been president since 1999 when Nigeria began the fourth republic.

item.title: Meru: Demu ahama ploti baada ya kugundua jirani ni 'Ex'
item.description: Mwanadada kutoka eneo la Kitunuri kaunti ya Meru aliwaacha wenyeji vinywa wazi baada ya kusanya virago vyake na kuhama ploti alipogundua jirani yake alikuwa mpenzi wake wa zamani. Umbea unaarifu kuwa demu ambaye alikuwa mgeni katika eneo hilo alipigwa na butwaa kupatana ana kwa ana na jamaa waliyechumbiana miaka miwili na kutengana. Habari Nyingine: Wachuuzi 3 hatarini kupigwa faini ya KSh4 milioni kwa kunaswa na karatasi za plastiki Kwa mujibu wa Taifa Leo, demu aliingia chumbani na kufunganya virago na kushika njia ghafla pasi na hata kumjulisha landilodi kuhusu hatia hiyo ya dharura.

item.title: Akinkunmi Amoo Gives Update On Injury After Prison Sentence For Sexual Assualt
item.description: Embattled Nigerian footballer, Akinkunmi Amoo, said he is looking forward to returning to football after months of being sidelined due to fitness issues. Akinkunmi Amoo has been out of football since September 2022 after sustaining an injury during a training session. He is expected to return to training on Thursday, June 29, 2023. Ahead of his stipulated period for his return to training, the former Golden Eaglets footballer said he met with his club’s medical team on Tuesday, June 27, to access his condition and he received favorable feedback.

The legendary entertainment news reporter Catt Sadler has interviewed some of the most prominent celebrities over her more than a decade-long career. She left E! News in 2017, after learning that she was paid around half of what one of her co-hosts, Jason Kennedy, was taking home.

item.description: The manager of Chelsea, Mauricio Pochettino, has revealed that the club owners, Todd Boehly and Behdad Eghbali, messaged him after a humiliating 2-4 defeat at the hands of Wolves at Stamford Bridge. Mauricio Pochettino was expected to be sacked after the humiliating defeat at the hands of Wolves on February 4, 2024. This defeat came after Liverpool humiliated the Blues at Anfied with a 4-1 spanking. These defeats have dropped Chelsea to the 11th spot with 31 points after 10 defeats, four draws, and just 9 wins.

item.title: Scorpios | Famous Birthdays
item.description: The eighth astrological sign, Scorpio is typically represented by the scorpion, but has also been associated with snakes and eagles. Scorpio is a water sign alongside Pisces and Cancer.  Trivia Musician Adam Ant released a song in 1985 called "Scorpio Rising" which in reference to the sign of Scorpio. The sign's name has also inspired numerous characters in popular movies and TV shows such as the Scorpio Killer in the 1971 film Dirty Harry and the title character in the 1973 spy film Scorpio.

item.title: Foor Doctor Warns Against Wearing Nike Sneakers

item.title: Disquiet In Miyetti Allah After Secretary Called Gov Masari 'Drunkard, Tired Leader'
item.description: Leaders of Miyetti Allah Kautal Hore (MAKH) in Kastina State have dissociated themselves from a comment by its National Secretary, Saleh Alhassan, describing Governor Aminu Masari as a “drunkard and a tired leader”. item.title: Woman Explains Why Young People Are Doom Spending Right Now
item.description: Woman Says Young People Are “Doom Spending” Because It’s Impossible for Them to Own HomesBy Mustafa GatollariPublished Jan. 22 2024, 4:10 p.m. ET Source: TikTok | @firstgenlivingRetail therapy doesn't really sound like a scientifically-backed treatment for anxiety or mental health issues, yet Ariana Grande wrote an entire song extolling its virtues. item.title: Heres How to Make a Blank Comment on TikTok Its Super Easy!
item.description: Here’s How People Are Leaving Blank Comments on TikTok VideosBy Abi TravisJun. 26 2020, Updated 12:15 p.m. ET Source: TikTok/@adamvbolt/@rossspangler/@theylovedae.xSometimes, there are just no words — and we don’t mean that metaphorically. Sometimes, when you look at TikTok comments, there are some that are completely blank. No words. It’s just the TikTok username, the date, and then nothing. It looks like leaving blank comments on TikTok videos started to become a trend in early 2020, but there are some people who still haven’t figured out how to do it.

item.title: I Was Given A Country With Bombs Going Off In Cities Buhari Laments
item.description: President Muhammadu Buhari has said that when he took over power in 2015 there were cities in Nigeria where bombs were being detonated with frightening frequency. Speaking during the passing-out parade and commissioning ceremony of cadets of regular Course 69 of the Nigerian Defence Academy, NDA, in Kaduna on Thursday, the president said the insecurity issues in the country were overwhelming when he took over power. He, however, insisted that his administration has being able to salvage the situation since he took over power in 2015.

item.title: PDP Mourns Mantu, Postpones NWC Meeting
item.description: The Peoples Democratic Party, PDP, has described the death of a former Deputy Senate President, Ibrahim Mantu, as a big blow which will be deeply felt by the party. The PDP spokesman, National Publicity Secretary, Mr Kola Ologbondiyan, made this known in a statement to commiserate with the family of the late Senator, on Tuesday. The statement reads, “Mantu’s death is indeed a big blow to our party, but we draw solace in the fact that he lived a fulfilled life and made impart in his calling as a patriot.

item.title: What Happened to the Jurors in Cocaine Cowboys'? Details
item.description: ‘Cocaine Cowboys’ on Netflix is the perfect mix of scandal and crime, and it turns out the case's jurors have as much of a hand in the crime as the culprits. As we get into the nitty gritty of Netflix’s Cocaine Cowboys, one thing is for sure: no one is innocent. In a rare twist of events, even the jurors had a hand in letting the drug kingpins off easy. Cocaine Cowboys chronicles the rise (and fall) of Sal Magluto and Willy Falcon as they built one of the biggest drug empires of all time, while hiding in plain sight.

item.title: Interior Minister Hosts Davido In Abuja (Photos)

item.title: Sokoto Gov Raises Corp Members Allowance By 100%
item.description: Sokoto state governor,  Ahmed Aliyu Sokoto, has raised the monthly allowance  of members of the National Youth Service Corps deployed to the state. Naija News reports, the allowance was increased from N5000 to N10,000. Aliyu made the announcement on Tuesday at the combined orientation camp  for both Sokoto and Zamfara in Farfaru, Sokoto. The Governor told the corp members that he “made the approval considering the current economic realities and the overall importance of the NYSC scheme to national and state development.

item.title: Unlike 'Atypical' and 'The Good Doctor,' 'Everything's Gonna Be Okay' Actually Cast an Autistic Acto
item.description: Is Kayla Cromer really autistic? She plays an autistic teenager on 'Everything's Gonna Be Okay, ‘ and viewers wonder if she’s on the spectrum. Source: gettyFrom the moment the trailer for Freeform's newest show, Everything's Gonna Be Okay, dropped, viewers were wondering whether actress Kayla Cromer was really autistic. That's because the trailer for the show, which premiered Jan. 16, opens with a little girl taking the podium at her father's funeral.

item.title: Your Hatred For Atiku Is Visible, Olisa Metuh Tells Bode George
item.description: A chieftain of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP), Olisa Metuh, has berated a former Deputy National Chairman of the party, Bode George, over his constant attacks on former Vice President, Atiku Abubakar. Metuh, a member of the party’s National Executive Committee, also accused George of working against the party’s presidential candidate, adding that his hatred for Atiku is now visible. He was reacting to the move by the camp of Governor Nyesom Wike of Rivers State to withdraw from the party’s campaign council and support Atiku’s campaign activities until the party’s National Chairman, Senator Iyorchia Ayu, resigns from his position.

item.title: Adriana de Moura on Emilio Estefan Music Collabs (EXCLUSIVE)
item.description: ‘RHOM’s’ Adriana Says More Music With Emilio Estefan Is “in the Pipeline” (EXCLUSIVE)Adriana de Moura of ‘RHOM’ told ‘Distractify’ that working with Emilio Estefan has been “the dream of a lifetime.” By Elizabeth RandolphFeb. 16 2024, Published 11:27 a.m. ET Source: BravoThroughout the years, we’ve seen several Real Housewives stars dive into the music scene, whether their fans asked for it or not. While the music biz hasn’t been kind to all of them, it’s undoubtedly boosted Real Housewives of Miami star Adriana de Moura’s pockets.

item.title: Amy Adams - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: Prolific actress well-known for her Academy Award-nominated roles in several films, including American Hustle, Junebug, Doubt, The Fighter, and The Master. She won a Golden Globe for Best Actress for her role in the 2014 film Big Eyes. She also starred in the Disney film Enchanted and had notable roles in Her, Sharp Objects, Arrival and Vice.   Before Fame She was born in Vicenza, Italy to American parents Richard Kent and Kathryn Adams. Raised with six siblings, she moved around a lot with her family before they settled in Castle Rock, Colorado in the early 1980s.

item.title: Dino Melaye Stirs Reactions Online As He Describes Atiku As Real President (Photo)
item.description: Former Kogi West Senator, Dino Melaye stirred reactions on social media on Tuesday when he described former Vice President of Nigeria, Atiku Abubakar as the real president. Taking to his account on the X platform, Melaye shared a picture of himself, Atiku, who contested the 2023 election as the presidential candidate of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP), and some other individuals eating at a restaurant. According to him, Atiku took them out to an exclusive restaurant.

item.title: Kiambu pastor makes passionate appeal to thief who stole his mobile phone
item.description: - Pastor Macharia resorted to publishing posters in a bid to ask a thief to return his stolen phone - The man of God lost his phone, an Itel A31, while in a matatu plying the Wangige-Kikuyu route - Macharia offered to buy the thief a new phone should he return his - The pastor claimed he suspects a man who was seated next to him in the matatu took his phone

item.title: Omokri Reacts To Jonathan Dumping PDP For APC
item.description: Reno Omokri, a former aide to ex-President Goodluck Jonathan has reacted to reports that his erstwhile principal is planning to dump the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) for the All Progressives Congress (APC). There have been ongoing rumours that Jonathan is set to join the nation’s ruling party in a bid to contest the 2023 presidential election. In a video released on Wednesday, Omokri described as ridiculous reports that the former Nigerian leader is planning to join the APC.

item.title: Aliko Dangote - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: Nigerian business magnate who was ranked 43rd richest person in the world and richest person in Africa in 2013. He was featured in Forbes as the 43rd richest man in Africa. Before Fame He studied business at Al-Azhar University in Egypt and then borrowed money from his uncle to start his first business. The Dangote group began in 1977 as a small trading company but grew into a multinational conglomerate.

item.title: Carolina Samani - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: Social media celebrity and fitness enthusiast who found her biggest fan base on Instagram. Her popular modeling, swimsuit and lifestyle photos have helped her pick up more than 250,000 total followers. Before Fame In November 2015, she uploaded her first Instagram pic which was an image of a colorful sky. Trivia She authored the digital e-books Caro Meals and No Pain, No Gain or Stay the Same. Family Life Her hometown is Charlotte, North Carolina but she moved to Jacksonville, Florida.

item.title: Emir Of Kano, Sanusi Dethroned
item.description: The Kano State government-led by Abdullahi Ganduje on Monday, March 9, dethroned Emir of Kano, Muhammad Sanusi II. Naija News reports Emir Sanusi’s dethronement followed the State Council executive meeting presided over by the Governor Ganduje. Sanusi was removed from office over allegations of gross insubordination. A statement by Alhaji Usman Alhaji, the Secretary to the Kano State Government, said Emir Sanusi’s dethronement was due to his “total disrespect to lawful instructions from the office of the governor and other lawful authorities.

Emir Of Kontagora Niger State Dies At 84
item.description: The Sarkin Sudan of Kontagora, Niger State, Alhaji Saidu Umaru Namaska, has died at the age of 84. Naija News reports that the late Emir, who spent 47 years on the throne, reportedly died at an Abuja Hospital. The late Emir’s death was confirmed to DailyTrust by a source close to the throne. The Emir’s death comes three months after bandits gunned down his son during an attack on the monarch’s farm.

item.title: Ricardo Chavira - Age, Family, Bio

Trivia He has had film roles in Piranha, Chasing 3000 and Don't Let Me Down. Family Life He married Marcea Dietzel in 2007, and the couple has two children, Tomas and Belen. item.title: If Queen Elizabeth II Had No Real Power, Why Did England Still Have a Queen?
item.description: If Queen Elizabeth II Had No Real Power, Why Did England Still Have a Queen? By Toni SuttonUpdated Sept. 8 2022, 2:19 p.m. ET Source: GETTY IMAGESUpdate: Queen Elizabeth II died peacefully on Thursday, Sept. 8, 2022, at Balmoral Castle in Scotland, according to an official tweet from The Royal Family. Members of the royal family, including the queen’s four children, and her grandchildren, Prince William and Prince Harry, traveled to Balmoral to be with her while she remained under medical supervision.

item.title: Isaac Carew - Age, Family, Bio

Trivia He got scouted for modeling in Selfridges at the age of 22 while in between jobs and decided to give it a shot on a whim.

item.title: M. Night Shyamalan - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: Filmmaker and actor who rose to fame for his 1999 suspense film The Sixth Sense. He then went on to direct the films Unbreakable, The Visit, The Village, Signs, and The Happening. Known for his psychological thrillers, he received additional fame for his Unbreakable film series. Before Fame He graduated from New York University's Tisch School of the Arts in 1992. While there he took on "Night" as his second name. He made his directorial debut in 1992 with the film Praying with Anger.

item.title: Father Mbaka Snubs DSS Invitation As Operatives Fail To Show Up
item.description: The Department of State Services (DSS) has failed to formally invite the Spiritual Director of the Adoration Ministry, Enugu, Rev. Fr. Ejike Mbaka. Recall that DSS operatives had on Thursday, June 3, stormed the Adoration Ministry to deliver a letter of invitation to Mbaka to come to Abuja for interrogation. Details of why the DSS summoned the priest, who they did not meet, were not stated but it might not be unconnected with Mbaka’s criticism of the Muhammadu Buhari government in recent times.

item.title: Paul Ryan - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: U.S. Congressman from Wisconsin who was chosen as the Vice Presidential Nominee for the Republican Party in the 2012 election. He became Chairman of the House Budget Committee in 2011 and he has introduced several budget proposals to congress. item.title: ISIS Leader, Adnan Abu Walid Al-Sahrawi Assassinated
item.description: A notorious ISIS leader identified as Adnan Abou Walid al-Sahraoui has been assassinated by the French military in West Africa. The United States of America had placed a price tag of $5million (£3.5m) on its head for killing US special forces soldiers. It was gathered that the terrorist was assassinated four years after ordering an attack in Niger which led to the death of four US servicemen, while several others were injured.

item.title: Ross Barnett - Trivia, Family, Bio
item.description: Politician and Democrat who was the Governor of Mississippi from 1960 to 1964. During the 1960s, was a staunch supporter of segregation, and was a major catalyst for the Ole Miss riot of 1962. Before Fame He was one of the top lawyers in Mississippi, earning more than 100,000 a year in conduction damage lawsuits, which financed his political campaign for governor. Trivia In 1962 he refused to enroll a black student, James Meredith, into the University of Mississippi, defying a direct Federal court order; the subsequent clashes near the campus killed several people.

item.title: Nigerian Military Has No Human Rights Case To Answer Under Buhari
item.description: The Minister of Defence, Major General Bashir Salihi Magashi (rtd) has submitted that the Nigerian Military is not guilty of any cases of human rights abuse in the discharge of its duties. Speaking on Thursday when he played host to the United States Acting Ambassador to Nigeria, Kathleen Fitz Gibbon, Magashi declared that the Nigerian Military under President Muhammadu Buhari upholds the highest standard of professionalism in the discharge of its duties.

item.title: NSCDC Reveals Where Criminals Are Hiding In Abuja
item.description: The Nigeria Security and Civil Defence Corps (NSCDC) has identified areas where criminal elements are lurking in the Federal Capital Territory (FCT) Abuja. On Thursday, the Commandant-General of the NSCDC, Dr Ahmed Audi, noted that recent intelligence reports have indicated the presence of criminals in the hills of Gwagwalada and Kwali area councils of FCT. Naija News understands that Audi disclosed this during the inauguration of the new Operation Office of the NSCDC at the Headquarters of the Kwali Local Government Council in Abuja, where he emphasized the need for collaboration between NSCDC personnel and sister agencies operating in the Gwagwalada and Kwali axis of the FCT.

item.title: Peter Obi Made Labour Party Popular, He May Win Without Structure
item.description: A political analyst in Zamfara State, Umar Mohammed has submitted that the candidate of the Labour Party (LP), Peter Obi may shock many people and win the 2023 presidential election. He pointed out that though his party does not have a recognized structure or functional offices in many states of the federation, Obi has won the support and admiration of many Nigerians. Mohammed added that the crisis rocking the two major parties in the country – the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) and the All Progressives Congress (APC) may just give the former Anambra State Governor the edge in the forthcoming elections.

item.title: 'I Was So Scared Cos I Got Many Death Wishes'

The mother of two girls said she was scared during her delivery as she continually felt something wrong was going to happen because of the many death wishes from online trolls.

item.title: APC Governor Plans To Host Peter Obi, Says He Likes His Ambition
item.description: The executive Governor of Ebonyi State, David Umahi has acknowledged that he likes the presidential ambition of former Governor of Anambra State, Peter Obi. The All Progressives Congress (APC) chieftain declared on Friday that he is ready to host the Labour Party presidential flagbearer whenever he visits Ebonyi. Naija News reports that Umahi stated this while appearing live on Arise TV programme today. During the interview, Umahi denied viral reports of him saying that Obi would not get a single vote from Ebonyi in the 2023 elections.

item.title: Atikus Camp 'Exposes' APCs Plan To Derail 2023 Election, Tinubus Ally Fires Back
item.description: The Atiku Abubakar/Okowa Presidential Campaign Organization has exposed an alleged plot by the Presidential candidate of the All Progressives Congress (APC), Bola Tinubu, to incite violence in order to derail the 2023 elections. In a statement to newsmen on Friday, the Spokesperson of the campaign, Kola Ologbodiyan, accused Tinubu of designing and promoting a plot to incite violence and disrupt the smooth conduct of the 2023 Presidential election. While stating that the former Lagos State governor is intimidated by the rising acceptance of the PDP Presidential Candidate, Atiku Abubakar, Ologbodiyan alleged that the APC presidential candidate has directed his party members to put aside decorum and deploy violence in the 2023 general elections.

item.description: Aborigines of the FCT have called on the Federal Government to heed the call for the restructuring of the country to allow the elevation of Abuja to the status of a state. In his address, the Emir of Karshi, HRH Alhaji Ismaila Mohammed, said the people have suffered marginalisation, neglect, deprivation and political exclusion because of their statelessness.

item.description: The Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) has claimed that unlike the All Progressives Congress (APC) which is running away from campaigning with President Muhammadu Buhari’s achievements because it plunged Nigerians into deeper hunger and poverty, it is proud of its records. According to the PDP in a statement by its Presidential Campaign Spokesman, Charles Aniagwu, unlike the APC which has nothing to show, it is very proud of running on records achieved during its 16 years of rule.

item.title: ZHC - Age, Family, Bio
Kristine Leahy - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: TV host and sportscaster known for hosting American Ninja Warrior. She also joined Colin Cowherd on his radio show, The Herd, when he moved to Fox Sports One. She previously worked for CBS Sports Network and covered sports in Los Angeles. Before Fame She attended Boston University, where she founded a sports talk show for the school's television station. After graduating, she got a job at WEEI in Boston. Trivia She called a horse race in 2013, in the process becoming the first woman in California history to do so.

item.title: Miyetti Allah Speaks On Presidential Candidate It Will Support
item.description: The Miyetti Allah Cattle Breeders Association of Nigeria (MACBAN) says it has not taken a final decision on the candidate the group will support for the 2023 presidential election. The Secretary of the group, Usman Ngerzema disclosed that the congress would meet and determine which of the candidates will get the block votes of its members or if they will remain neutral this time around. According to Ngerzema, MACBAN consists of members with diverse political affiliations and the decision on which candidate or party to support has not been finalized.

item.title: My Momma Wouldve Beat Me Kids Leave Trash Around Tables
item.description: “Clean Up Your Mess!” — Kids Slammed for Leaving Pile of Trash on Mall Food Court TablesBy Mustafa GatollariPublished June 19 2023, 8:39 a.m. ET Source: TikTok | @kellzjaeSome people were raised so poorly that they think it's perfectly acceptable to not clean up after themselves. Whether it's at the movie theater, a restaurant, the school cafeteria, a friend's house, or the food court at the mall, there are folks who have no qualms with leaving food, refuse, drinks, shredded bits of paper, whatever, for someone else to clean up.

item.title: 'I Have Raped Nine Girls'
item.description: The Western Nigeria Security Network codenamed, Amotekun, has arrested a 16-year-old teenager, identified as Precious, for allegedly raping his brother’s wife and nine girls in Ondo State. Naija News reports the suspect was paraded before newsmen on Friday, November 11, 2022, and he admitted to committing the crime. Speaking with journalists, the state commander of Amotekun, Adetunji Adeleye, said that the suspect raped the wife of his brother when he travelled outside the town.

item.title: John Lydon - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: British singer better known by his stage name Johnny Rotten. He sang lead vocals for the punk rock band The Sex Pistols. Before Fame He worked as a London minicab dispatcher. Trivia He appeared in the 1983 Italian crime film Copkiller. Family Life He married Nora Forster, the German heiress to a publishing company. He adopted her two children from a previous relationship. Associated With He and Sid Vicious were bandmates in The Sex Pistols.

item.title: Nigerias security situation better than in 2015- Lai Mohammed
item.description: President Muhammadu Buhari-led government on Monday said although the country is facing security issues, the security situation is better than it was during the 2015 government. The Minister of Information and Culture, Lai Mohammed, made this claim while speaking at a press conference in Abuja on Monday. The Minister of Interior, Rauf Aregbesola, was also at the press conference. He said, “I can say without hesitation that, though Nigeria is facing security challenges, the situation is far better than what we met in 2015.

item.title: Sameer Gadhia - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: Vocalist known for being the lead singer and founder of the Young the Giantt. Their second full-length album, Mind over Matter, peaked at number seven on the Billboard 200. Before Fame The band originally formed as The Jakes in 2004, but remained small and largely local until late 2009, when they changed their name and signed to Roadrunner Records. Trivia He was studying at Stanford University, where he was part of an a cappella group, when he decided to pause his studies and pursue music full-time in 2009.

item.title: Woman Calls Out Besties Friends for Ditching Her Baby Shower
item.description: Woman Goes All Out for Friend’s Baby Shower and None of Her Friends Showed UpBy Mustafa GatollariPublished Jan. 19 2023, 5:45 p.m. ET Source: GettyIt's a bitter pill to swallow when you realize that while you may have a bunch of friends that the majority of them aren't going to be there for you when you want or need them the most. Wanting to share good things happening in your life with someone else is about as natural as wincing in pain upon hearing a grating Influencer's voice, so when you're stood up by your friends on a special day it can be especially painful.

item.title: 10-year-old computer guru appointed to teach in UK school
item.description: - A Nigerian whiz kid has been offered a teaching job at an after-school club in England - The 10-year-old got the teaching job after she was discovered to be computer proficient - The school said the young girl is very passionate about sharing knowledge with her age mates - The smart kid advised the Nigerian government to set up infrastructures that would encourage children to learn to code at a young age

item.title: Electoral Act Can Be Amended As NASS Members Consult Nigerians
item.description: Even if he cared little about his legacy and supposed integrity, President Muhammadu Buhari should have spared a thought for Nigeria and Nigerians in his recent decision to decline assent to the Electoral Act (amendment) Bill jointly passed by the National Assembly. Nigerians and the country have given so much to Buhari to make him place the public interest above parochial interest on matters of State. As bad as it is for him to have vetoed the legislation, how he did this is disheartening and raises questions over the interest of a President who is serving out his final term in office.

item.description: Australian presenter who is best known as co-host of Today and National Nine News. Before Fame He earned a degree in journalism from Queensland University of Technology in 1994. Family Life He has three children named Jackson, Ava, and River with Cassandra Thorburn, whom he was married to for over 20 years before separating in 2016.

item.title: Lionel Messi Says Goodbye To Barcelona
item.description: Argentina captain, Lionel Messi on Sunday was in tears at the start of the Barcelona press conference over his future on Sunday. This is coming after La Liga side, Barcelona announced that they are unable to seal a deal with their long time captain, who is reportedly close to a move to Paris Saint-Germain. He said, “These recent days I’ve been thinking, giving a lot of thought to what I can say.

item.title: Man Forced to Escape From Injured Bird He Rescued
item.description: This Man Ended Up Having To Escape The Injured Bird He RescuedBy Aimee LutkinUpdated Oct. 31 2018, 5:13 p.m. ET Source: TwitterWe've all seen those commercials of workers rescuing wildlife that have been injured by an oil spill or wildfire, so it's natural to want to channel your inner Steve Irwin and save all the animals. However, it's not as easy as it seems (no matter how many times you have watched the Discovery Channel) and often times, rescuing wild animals is a dangerous game.

item.title: 107 Fleeing Inmates Return Out Of 1,844 Fugitives Prison Service
item.description: The Nigerian Correctional Service on Monday disclosed the 107 inmates that escaped from the Owerri facility have either returned or been arrested. The development was confirmed by the spokesman of NCS, Francis Enobore, on Monday. He noted that more inmates would return with the release of the fleeing inmates’ photographs and bio-data. When asked if a bounty would be placed on over 3,000 fleeing inmates nationwide, he stated that it was not his decision to make but left with the authorities.

item.title: Fayose, Oni Clash Over PDP Governorship Candidate
item.description: A governorship aspirant under the Peoples Democratic Party, Segun Oni, has accused a former Governor of Ekiti State, Ayodele Fayose of selling out the party’s candidate to the All Progressives Congress. Oni condemned the National Working Committee led by Iyorchia Ayu for ratifying the result of the primary, which he alleged was in a shoddy and abysmal manner. The former Governor in a statement released through the Director-General of his campaign organisation, Yemi Arokodare on Sunday titled, ‘Kolawole is APC candidate’s duplicate copy Oni’, said “The candidate of the PDP and Fayose’s protégé, Bisi Kolawole, can be best described as a duplicate copy of the APC candidate in the June 18 governorship election.

item.title: Michelle Rodriguez (Movie Actress) - Age, Family, Bio
Notorious Bandit Terrorist Declared Wanted Crowned Sarkin Fulani Of Zamfara (Photos)
item.description: Notorious terror kingpin, Ado Aleru has been turbaned  as the Sarkin Fulani (the chief of the Fulani) of the Yandoton Daji Emirate in Zamfara State. This is coming hours after the occasion was exposed in a publication where it was reported that the decision to give Aleru a traditional title was aimed at finding lasting peace in the crisis-ravaged Tsafe and Yandoton Daji emirates and other areas of Zamfara and Katsina states, which the terrorist had constantly attacked with his fighters.

item.title: Politics Not Do Or Die, Dont Turn Oyo Into Battlefield PDP Warns APC
item.description: The ruling party in Oyo State, the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) has reacted to the internal crisis among stakeholders of the All Progressives Congress (APC) in the state. PDP observed that the APC is currently divided over supremacy, hence, warned that the state must not be turned into a battleground ahead of the 2023 elections. Naija News understands that crisis had started in the APC in Oyo after the party conducted its State congress on Saturday, 30th October 2021.

item.title: Ademola Adeleke To Be Sworn In As Osun State Governor Today
item.description: Osogbo, the Osun State capital will be agog today as it plays host to politicians and supporters of Senator Ademola Adeleke who is set to be inaugurated as the sixth civilian Governor of the state. Naija News understands the inauguration would be conducted by the Chief Judge of Osun State, Justice Adepele Ojo at the Osogbo Township Stadium in the state capital. Adeleke would be sworn in along with his deputy, Prince Kola Adewusi.

item.title: Avery McGraw - Age, Family, Bio

item.description: Netflix's 'Old Enough!' One of the latest shows on the roster that was added in April 2022 is called Old Enough!

item.title: Melaye Reveals 'Spiritual Strategy' By PDP For Atiku To Win Election
item.description: The spokesperson for the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) Presidential Campaign Committee, Dino Melaye has revealed a spiritual strategy adopted by members of the party for Atiku Abubakar to emerge victorious in 2023. Speaking on Monday, Melaye disclosed that many PDP members have stopped sinning so God can hear their prayers about Atiku. Naija News reports he made the submission in Kaduna State during the PDP presidential rally. Speaking in Hausa language, the former Kogi Central Senator said their mind is made up and they won’t relent until Atiku emerges victorious at the polls.

Jamaa wa miaka 28 ajitoa uhai kwa kunywa sumu baada ya kugundua yuko na virusi vya HIV
item.description: Jamaa mmoja mwenye umri wa miaka 28 kutoka mtaa wa Embakasi jijini Nairobi amejitoa uhai baada ya kugundua yuko na virusi vya HIV Meshack Henry Odhiambo alifariki dunia Jumanne Aprili 9, baada ya kunywa sumu pamoja na kumeza dawa za kupunguza makali ya virusi (ARVs) kupita kiasi. Kulingana na stakabadhi zake kutoka hospitali ya Mbagathi, Odhiambo aliamua kujitoa uhai dakika chache tu baada ya kutembelea kituo cha afya ambapo alikuwa amekwenda kujua hali yake ya kiafya.

Though the original stars are returning, including Anisha Ramakrishna, Shaan Patel, Vishal Parvani, Brian Benni, Amrit Kapai, Bali Chainani, and Monica Vaswani, the family is getting a bit bigger this time around.

item.title: What Is She Doing Today?
item.description: Claudette Colvin now: In celebration of Black History Month, read on to learn more about her inspirational background and where she is today. The Montgomery bus boycott is often synonymous with American activist Rosa Parks. However, civil rights pioneer Claudette Colvin preceded her. In March 1955, nine months before Parks refused to give up her seat to a white man, 15-year-old Colvin did the same thing. Now 83 years old, Colvin’s courageous actions shape her legacy.

item.title: The Sims - Gamers, Ages, Trivia
item.description: Allows players to create a character to live in a simulated world, running the personal and career endeavors of the created character. Trivia The game's designer Will Wright was inspired to create the game after losing his own home during the 1991 Oakland firestorm. In the process of building his new home and replacing his possessions, he had the idea of adapting the experience into a game. With over 200 million copies of the game sold worldwide, the series has become one of the most popular video game series of all time.

item.title: Gen Z Working Corporate Job Goes Viral
item.description: “I’m Taking My Meetings in Bed” — Corporate Gen-Z Behaviors Spark Debate About Laziness"I’m a Gen Z in corporate. Why are we having a Zoom call when you could’ve sent an email?" By Mustafa GatollariPublished Feb. 19 2024, 8:42 a.m. ET Gen-Z workers are often maligned as being lazy, unwilling to work, and entitled employees who are deluded as to what being successful entails. However, many would argue that these traits are ultimately positive ones and that Gen-Z employees (and in some instances, Millennials), are actually more cognizant of their value and willing to stand up for themselves in corporate/business settings.

item.title: I Need To Tach Our Youths How To Live A Meaningful Life - Desmond Elliot
item.description: Well-known and award-winning actor Desmond Elliot has come out and told his fans why he took the decision to go into politics full time. The recent graduate of Economics from the Lagos State University told NigTribune that the reason he was running for a seat in the Lagos State House of Reps was to help out the common men. He said: "The current situation is very pathetic. I feel God has helped me thus far and I want to give back through politics that will be favourable to the youths.

item.title: Stop Addressing Nigerians Through Your Aides
item.description: President Muhammadu Buhari has been condemned by the lawmaker representing Borno South senatorial district, Ali Ndume for his silence on security challenges in the country. The Chairman of the Senate Committee on the Army called on the President to stop addressing Nigerians through his aides on important issues. The lawmaker noted that if the President of the United States of America could be holding press briefings every day on situations in Afghanistan, President Buhari should also address Nigerians often.
