item.title: 'Big Brother 24' Is Almost Here Let's Meet the Cast!
item.description: 'Big Brother 24' is right around the corner, so let's meet the cast members! Plus, stick around for details about the upcoming season. With the premiere of Big Brother 24 happening on July 6, 2022, CBS has finally unveiled the 16 brand new (that's right, no returning cast members) houseguests set to enter the "BB Motel." Article continues below advertisement Each houseguest will be kept on their toes and pushed beyond their limits for the entire summer, thanks to some brand-spanking-new challenges and twists that will figuratively flip the house upside down.

item.title: Boko Haram Threatens To Kill Parents, Abducted Girls If Search Not Stopped
item.description: Grieving parents of the abducted 234 female students of Government Girls’ Secondary School, (GGSS), Chibok in Borno State took the initiative in the search for their own kids. The parents, who wished to remain anonymous, claimed that they had received threats from Boko Haram members with their willingness to kill them and their children if they continue the search for the abducted students. Speaking on the Hausa Service of the Voice of America, monitored in Kaduna on Tuesday, they said that at least 100 okada riders (commercial motorcyclists) were hired by parents to intensify their search but without succes.

item.title: Buhari To Address Nigerians On Friday
item.description: Nigeria President, Muhammadu Buhari, will on Friday deliver his New Year message to Nigerians through a national broadcast. The development was disclosed in a statement titled ‘President Buhari makes New Year broadcast.’ and released by the President Senior Special Assistant on Media and Publicity, Garba Shehu. The statement read, “President Muhammadu Buhari will make a New Year broadcast to the nation Friday, January 1, 2021, at 7 am.” “Television, radio and other electronic media outlets are enjoined to join the network services of the Nigerian Television Authority and Federal Radio Corporation of Nigeria respectively, for the broadcast.

item.title: Ribadu, State Governors Meet Over Insecurity, Fuel Subsidy Palliatives
item.description: President Bola Ahmed Tinubu‘s National Security Adviser, Nuhu Ribadu, met with the Nigeria Governors Forum (NGF) on Thursday in Abuja to deliberate on the rising insecurity challenges in the country. Among other agenda of the meeting is how to ensure smooth distribution of palliative to Nigerians to cushion the effect of the removal of subsidy on Premium Motor Spirit (PMS) and the recently signed electricity act. In a statement posted on Twitter today, the chief press secretary to Niger State Governor, Mohammed Bago, Bologi Ibrahim, said Kwara State Governor AbdulRahman AbdulRazaq chaired the meeting.

item.title: Viewers Talk SNL Stars Gait
item.description: Kate McKinnon’s walk in her Verizon commercials has viewers perplexed: Does the ‘Saturday Night Live’ star always walk like that? Read the comments. Now that its former “Can you hear me now?” guy is shilling for rival wireless network T-Mobile, Verizon has enlisted a two-time Emmy winner to appeal to viewers. But it seems those who have seen Kate McKinnon’s Verizon television commercials have just one question on their mind: Why does she walk the way she does in those commercials, and, as one forum user added, “Is that her normal gait?

item.title: 'Thank God APC's Lyon Did Not Emerge Bayelsa Governor, Timipre Sylva Remains Our Leader'
item.description: Former All Progressives Congress (APC) spokesman, Nabena Yekini, has expressed gladness David Lyon did not emerge governor of Bayelsa State. Recall that Lyon had won the Bayelsa Governorship election in 2019 but his election was nullified by the Supreme Court. The Apex court ruled that his running mate Degi Eremienyo Wangagra submitted a fake certificate to the Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC). Speaking in an interview with SUN, Nabena slammed Lyon for not appreciation those that gave him the ticket to run on the APC platform.

item.title: Natalie DuToit - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: Paralympian swimmer who competed in the 2008 Summer Olympics in Beijing, becoming the first amputee to ever qualify for the Olympics. Before Fame She was a competitive swimmer as a teenager before having her leg amputated in 2001; she was swimming again in just three months. Trivia She won five gold medals at the 2004 Summer Paralympics and retired after the 2012 Paralympics. Family Life She was born in Cape Town, South Africa.

item.title: Omokri Reacts To Ex-CBN Deputy Governor, Obadiah Mailafias Death
item.description: A former presidential aide, Reno Omokri has reacted to the demise of a former Deputy Governor of the Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN), Mailafia Obadiah. Naija News reports that the statesman died on Sunday morning at the National Hospital in Abuja. Mailafia before his death was a known critic of President Muhammadu Buhari-led government. One of the controversial comments by the deceased was alleging that a sitting governor is spearheading the affairs of the Boko Haram terrorists in the country.

item.title: Ondo Doctors Threaten Strike Due To Poor Welfare Package
item.description: The Nigerian Medical Association (NMA) in Ondo state has issued a seven-day ultimatum to the state government regarding the inadequate welfare packages for doctors in the state. They have warned of potential industrial action if the Ondo state government fails to address their demands within the stipulated timeframe. The stance of the Nigerian Medical Association (NMA) was articulated in a communique issued after the association’s Ordinary General Meeting (OGM), which expressed dismay over the persistent departure of doctors from the state due to inadequate welfare packages.

item.title: Where Is 'a Discovery of Witches' Filmed? Locations From the Book Come to Life
item.description: Sky One Network's 'A Discovery of Witches' takes place across Europe, primarily in the U.K. Where was the show actually filmed? Here's what we know. Source: InstagramSky One series A Discovery of Witches captured audience imaginations everywhere with the enchanting tale of magic, romance, and adventure. While the show is, unfortunately, coming to an end in Season 3, that hasn't stopped fans from wanting to re-live the magic by visiting all the fantastical locations from the show.

item.title: FUTMINNA eportal login, registration, admission, course registration
item.description: FUTMINNA eportal is an electronic online platform of the Federal University of Technology, Minna. The university is commonly referred to as FUTMINNA, and its electronic portal serves as a link between the university’s students and staff. It has integrated services such as payments of different sorts, application for admission, course registration, and many more. FUTMINNA is an institute of higher learning. It was founded on February 1st, 1983, and specializes in technological training.

Sunday Igboho Issues Fresh Eviction Notice To Fulani Herdsmen
item.description: Popular Yoruba activist, Sunday Adeyemo, popularly known as Sunday Igboho, has issued a fresh eviction notice to killer Fulani herdsmen in the South-West. Naija News reports that Sunday Igboho made this known in an interview anchored by his spokesperson, Oluyomi Koiki. While stressing that he will ensure they are all smoked out of the forests very soon, Igboho said that he would never give any order without monitoring compliance. Igboho also insisted that no governor can stop Yoruba nation rally, noting if any governor says that, it will not be obeyed because Yorubaland belongs to all Yoruba indigenes.

item.title: These Old School Life Hacks From Print Are the Worst

item.title: Chelsea 'Can't' Win Premier League This Season
item.description: Chelsea manager, Thomas Tuchel, has lamented the current situation with the club, expressing doubt about his team winning the 2021/22 English Premier League title. Naija News reports that Tuchel’s submission is coming after Chelsea were held to a 1-1 draw by Brighton on Wednesday night at Stamford Bridge. The Blues have played 20 games in the ongoing campaign and currently sit in second place with 42 points, a point ahead of Liverpool which has a game in hand.

item.title: Three Important Questions Bishops Asked Tinubu [Read APC Presidential Candidate Response]
item.description: Details have emerged revealing the discussions between leaders of the Arewa Church under the aegis of the Pentecostal Bishops Forum of Northern Nigeria with the presidential candidate of All Progressives Congress (APC), Asiwaju Bola Ahmed Tinubu. Naija News earlier reported that Tinubu had met with the Bishops last Thursday at the APC Presidential Campaign Headquarters in Abuja over his decision to pick former governor of Borno State, Kashim Shettima, as his running mate.

item.title: After Collecting Millions From Nigerians, Adamu Garba Withdraws From 2023 Presidential Race
item.description: Presidential hopeful, Adamu Garba has announced that he will not be joining the contest for the All Progressives Congress (APC) presidential ticket. Naija News reports that the controversial politician made the announcement in a thread on his Twitter account on Tuesday evening. It was gathered that the withdrawal was following the donation of over N83 million by Nigerians for him to purchase the APC expression of interest and nomination forms which would cost N100 million.

item.title: Buhari Govt Declares Public Holiday To Mark 61st Independence Day
item.description: The Muhammadu Buhari-led federal and has declared Friday, October 1 as public holiday celebrate Nigeria’s 61st Independence Anniversary Celebration. This was made known as by Minister of Interior, Ogbeni Rauf Aregbesola, Naija News reports. He congratulated all Nigerians on this year’s Celebration of the Country’s 61st anniversary and assured of Government’s commitment to tackling and eradicating all forms of challenges –be they political, socio-economic or otherwise. Aregbesola was quoted as saying that “our warmth, welcoming spirit and love as well as the abundant wealth inherent in our human capital and the richness of our land, makes Nigeria unarguably the leading black nation in the world and Africa’s pride and beacon of hope, if we can rally ourselves together to harness our potentials.

item.title: Shehu Sani Speaks On Murder Of Senator NaAllahs Son
item.description: The former lawmaker representing Kaduna Central senatorial district, Shehu Sani, has reacted to the killing of the eldest son of Senator Bala Na’Allah, Abdulkarim Bala Na’Allah on Sunday. Naija News had earlier reported that unknown assailants killed the lawmaker’s son at his Malali home in Kaduna. The Special Adviser to the lawmaker, Garba Mohammed while confirming the incident said the gunmen entered the house through the ceiling. Mohammed further disclosed that the security guard of the deceased’s neighbour noticed that the gate was opened and raised the alarm, which led to the discovery of the remains of the pilot.

item.title: Talking to Yourself Is Actually a Good Thing According to Science
item.description: Talking to Yourself Is Actually a Good Thing According to ScienceBy Mark PygasUpdated May 29 2019, 9:38 a.m. ET Source: iStockChances are that you talk to yourself mentally at various points throughout the day. Whether it's to help yourself with something at work, or to convince yourself that you don't need a third coffee at 10 a.m. in the morning. But have you ever said something like that out loud? If you answered yes, you could be one of the smartest people around.

item.title: Who Is Richard Gant Playing in 'The Wonder Years'?

From umpire to preacher, right back down to himself, he has embodied countless characters in film, television, and theater. It's easy to see why — he's an accomplished actor as well as a philanthropist. Now Richard is about to take it back to 1968 as he joins the reboot of The Wonder Years.

item.title: APC To Begin Campaign With Solidarity March
item.description: The ruling All Progressives Congress (APC) will on Wednesday begin its presidential campaign nationwide with a solidarity march. Naija News reports that the APC and other political parties will start their presidential campaigns nationwide on September 28 in line with the directive of the Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC). According to a statement released by the Tinubu Presidential Campaign Council, the solidarity march would start from the Presidential Campaign Council (PCC) office on Herbert Macaulay Way, Central Business District, Abuja, to the Unity Fountain, Maitama.

item.description: Former Governor of Lagos State and presidential candidate of the All Progressives Congress (APC), Bola Ahmed Tinubu hails from the South-South region, says a Delta State politician, Ariyi Emami. Naija News understands that the 45-year-old party chieftain made the assertion while projecting Tinubu as the best person to succeed President Muhammadu Buhari come 2023. Emami while interacting with newsmen on Tuesday described the combination of Tinubu and former Governor of Borno State, Kashim Shettima as a good product that the ruling party can easily market.

item.title: Four PDP Chieftains, Supporters Defect To APC In Kebbi State
item.description: At least four Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) chieftains in Kebbi State have withdrawn their membership from the party, blaming their decision on the crisis rocking the umbrella camp. The politicians who hail from the Zuru Emirate of Kebbi, alongside their supporters, immediately pledged their allegiance to the ruling All Progressives Congress (APC), Naija News learnt. The defectors include Alhaji Shehu Ribah from Danko/Wasagu; Alhaji Nuhu Goma from Zuru; Alhaji Adamu Jalalo from Fakai and Alhaji Babuga Diri from Sakaba Local Government Areas of the state.

item.title: President Buharis New Year Day Message To Nigerians (Full Text)
item.description: President Muhammadu Buhari, on Saturday, released a letter to Nigerians to commemorate the 2022 New Year. Buhari expressed gratitude to God for another year attained as a country, united by a common destiny and resolute in our determination to overcome the several challenges along the path to build the great and prosperous nation of our dream. The President identified some challenges affecting the progress of the country and the readiness of his administration to tackle the issues.

item.description: The National Association of Seadogs (Pyrates Confraternity) has tackled the federal government for using the National Broadcasting Commission (NBC) to clampdown on Channels TV. item.title: Early morning multiple bombing reported in Maiduguri, Borno state
item.description: Reports say Maiduguri, the capital of Borno state has witnessed an early morning multiple bombing. Reuters report quoted the police as confirming the incident adding that the Borno police commissioner, Damian Chukwu, said it happened at around 4:30 am. item.title: Gunmen Ambush Police Officers In Anambra, Kill Two, Burn Their Bodies
item.description: Some yet-to-be identified gunmen have executed a daring ambush attack on operatives of the Nigeria Police in Anambra State. The policemen who were travelling, ran into an ambush by the gunmen as confirmed in a statement on Sunday by the Anambra Command spokesperson, Ikenga Tochukwu. He explained that the policemen fought back after running into the ambush but two of them lost their lives while one is still unaccounted for.

item.title: Nigerian Army Rewards 10 Soldiers For Exceptional Performance
item.description: The Nigerian Army has rewarded ten soldiers for their outstanding contributions in combating banditry and kidnapping across the nation. The soldiers honoured are Ojo Benjamin, Yunisia Dorcas, Attah Patience, Aminu Salihu, Taiwo Rashidat, Ibrahim Ibrahim, Adayami John, Alabi Helen, Ekemode Musa, and Agbe Mary.

item.title: Super Eagles Arrive In Abuja Monday
item.description: Following their exit from the ongoing African Cup of Nations (AFCON) in Cameroon, the Super Eagles players and officials will on Monday return to the country. The team will leave Garoua airport in Cameroon at 7:30pm aboard a chartered Air Peace airline for an hour flight to the Nnamdi Azikiwe Airport, Abuja. The players and coaches will be received at the airport by the Nigerian Football Federation (NFF) President, Amaju Melvin Pinnick and members of his cabinet.

item.title: Court Rules On Suit Challenging Tinubu's Age, Citizenship
item.description: A Federal High Court in Abuja has rejected a lawsuit aiming to prevent the inauguration of President-elect, Bola Tinubu and his deputy, Kashim Shettima. The suit alleged age and citizenship discrepancies in the documents Tinubu submitted to the Independent National Electoral Commission. Justice James Omotosho, delivering the ruling on Friday, described the action brought by Praise Ilemona Isaiah, Pastor Paul Isaac Audu, and Anongu Moses as ‘frivolous’ and an ‘abuse of court process’.

item.title: Ayu Reveals Stand On Resigning As PDP National Chairman
item.description: The National Chairman of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) Senator Iyiochia Ayu has declared he has no intention of resigning from his position over the current crisis which has engulfed the party. Ayu in a statement on Monday through his special assistant on communication and strategy, Simon Imobo-Tswam said that he intends to see out the four-year mandate given to him by the PDP. He made the declaration amidst reports that the camp of Rivers State Governor, Nyseom Wike has demanded his resignation as part of the solutions to the crisis affecting the PDP.

item.description: Shade Silifat Abdulkadir, the mother of the three children who tragically suffocated to death in a parked car in Ilorin, the capital of Kwara State, last Sunday, has spoken out about the heartbreaking incident. During an interview with journalists regarding the final moments of her deceased children, Shade, aged 37, made a heartfelt plea to Nigerians for assistance. Naija News gathered that all three children, the first child, Maryam, aged 10, the second child, Nudrah, aged 8, and the third child, Mohammed, aged 2, tragically died from suffocation inside a car parked at their residence, which their father had borrowed from his elder brother.

item.title: US Threatens Visa Ban On Election Riggers, Troublemakers
item.description: Ahead of Saturday’s governorship election in Anambra State, the United States has threatened to impose visa restrictions on election riggers and troublemakers in the state. item.description: A friend and classmate of Abdulkarim Bala Na’Allah has disclosed that the home of the deceased was burgled two months before he was murder. Naija News had earlier reported that the son of Senator Bala Na’Allah was found tied and strangled on Sunday in his Malali home in Kaduna. The state police command had said the assailants escaped with the deceased’s Lexus SUV. According to Daily Trust, the deceased former classmate noted that they spoke on video call on Friday evening before the pilot said he had an emergency to attend to.

Okocha urged the governor to re-present  the 2024 budget to the Assembly.

item.title: Woman Checks Empty Bag at Airport for Free SkyMiles

Naturally, it's easy to want to earn as many SkyMiles as possible without spending too much money to get them, right?

item.title: Atiku Is Fulani But He's Not A Killer
item.description: The wife of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) presidential candidate, Titi Abubakar has submitted that her husband, Atiku Abubakar is not a killer. She observed that her husband is truly a Fulani man but is not a killer in any way. Naija News reports she made her point while speaking on Wednesday at the campaign rally held in Akure, the Ondo State capital. Addressing the crowd of supporters at the event, Atiku’s wife added that the former Vice President won the 2019 presidential election in Nigeria but was robbed.

item.title: Buhari Didn't Endorse Me As Next APC National Chairman
item.description: Former Governor of Nasarawa State, Senator Abdullahi Adamu has denied reports that President Muhammadu Buhari has endorsed him as the consensus candidate for the national chairmanship position of the All Progressives Congress (APC). Recall that the president reportedly endorsed Adamu in a meeting with governors elected on the platform of the ruling party at the Presidential Villa, Abuja. After the meeting, it was said that some governors rejected the endorsement of the former governor as the next party chairman, saying that his performance as the chairman of the APC reconciliation committee was also not encouraging to give him the mandate.

item.title: Chinese Man Stabs 23-Year-Old Nigerian Lover To Death
item.description: A 23-year-old woman identified as Ummakulsum Sani Buhari has been allegedly stabbed to death by a Chinese man. The incident happened at Janbulo quarters, Kumbotso local government area of Kano. The development was confirmed by the Police Public Relations Officer in Kano State, Abdullahi Haruna Kiyawa. Naija News learnt that the incident happened around 10 pm on Friday after the Chinese man came to visit Ummakulsum at her parents’ house located adjacent National Environmental Standards and Regulations Enforcement Agency (NESREA) office.

item.description: Eterno Hotels in Benin City has reportedly cancelled the booking of the Edo State Deputy Governor, Philip Shaibu, to use the venue to declare his governorship ambition today formally. item.title: VIDEO: I Have Full Confidence In My Chief Of Staff
item.description: President Bola Ahmed Tinubu says he has full confidence in the integrity of his Chief of Staff, Femi Gbajabiamila. Tinubu stated this on Monday while presiding over the fourth Federal Executive Council (FEC) meeting of his administration at the Council Chamber of the Presidential Villa in Abuja. The President admitted that his administration will make mistakes, noting that he is ready to take responsibility for the mistakes made. President Tinubu, therefore, stated that all campaigns of calumny against the former Speaker of the House of Representatives must stop immediately.

item.title: Gandujes Commissioner Resigns, Defects To NNPP
item.description: The Commissioner of Finance under the Governor Abdullahi Ganduje-led government in Kano State, Shehu Na’Allah Kura has resigned. item.title: I Have Disagreed With Obasanjo On Important Issues
item.description: Presidential hopeful and national leader of the All Progressives Congress (APC), Bola Tinubu,  has hailed former President Olusegun Obasanjo as he marks his 85th birthday. In a congratulatory statement sent to Naija News on Saturday by his media aide, Tunde Rahman, Tinubu praised Obasanjo for his patriotism and unfailing commitment to the unity of the country. He stated that although he has disagreed with Obasanjo on many important issues, he added that their debates have always remained professional.

item.title: Dominance Of Israel Adesanya In MMA Wows UFC Bantamweight Champion

Mixed Martial Arts fans were shocked by Adesanya’s second-round knockout victory against Brazilian fighter Alex Pereira to reclaim his middleweight title and by the fact that he ultimately triumphed over Pereira who has defeated him twice in the past. With this victory, the Nigerian-New Zealander fighter has now beaten the top five middleweights fighters and Sean O’Malley is deeply impressed by this feat and had to compare the reign of Israel Adesanya to that of legendary Nurmagomedov.

item.description: The Nigerian Army has disclosed that some Boko Haram terrorist who has been dropping arms and surrendering to the military do not understand why they are doing so. The Theatre Commander, Joint Task Force (North-East) Operation Hadin Kai, Maj. Gen. Christopher Musa, while speaking on the issue said, “Some of the surrendered insurgents will tell you they don’t even understand how they are surrendering and coming out in droves.” Musa disclosed this while speaking with newsmen in Abuja while on a media tour to Maiduguri to assess the progress made by the army in the fight against terrorism.

item.title: Fani-Kayode Reacts As Ayo Adebanjo Becomes Afenifere Leader
item.description: Former Minister of Aviation Femi Fani-Kayode has congratulated Pa Ayo Adebanjo over his appointment as the acting national leader of the pan Yoruba socio-political group, Afenifere. Citing age as his reasoning for stepping down, Afenifere’s former leader, Pa Reuben Fasoranti, 95, said that the group needs a vibrant and active person to drive it. He thereafter named former deputy leader, Adebanjo as the acting national leader of the group while the former financial secretary, Oba Oladipo Olaitan, the Alaago of Kajola Ago, Atakumosa East council area, Ilesa, Osun state was named the group’s deputy leader.

item.title: Lionel Messi Joins PSG On Two-year Contract
item.description: Argentine International Lionel Messi has agreed to join Paris Saint-Germain on a two-year contract, Naija News reports. The six-time Ballon d’Or winner arrived in Paris on Tuesday afternoon to seal his move to the French club on a deal worth £25m per year after tax, plus bonuses. Messi had two other options after leaving Barcelona last week but has opted to move to PSG, who will have the option of extending his stay in the French capital by the third year.

item.title: NAF Hits Boko Haram Strong Hold, Confirms Killing Of Terrorists Commanders, 100 Insurgents In Borno

item.title: 2023: Why APC Defeated PDP In Previous Elections

item.title: Accept The Policy Changes In Nigeria - Buhari To Indians
item.description: President Muhammadu Buhari has warned Indian businessmen that some of his policies will one way or the other affect their business interests in Nigeria. The president who made the statement today, October 28, in New Delhi, India however assured them that despite the fall in oil prices, his government is committed to maintaining macro-economic stability and improving investor confidence in Nigeria. [article_adwert] According to PM News, Buhari made the comment at an interactive session with chief executives of Indian companies with interests in Nigeria.

item.title: Ademola Adeleke Sworn In As Governor Of Osun
item.description: Former Senator, Ademola Adeleke has been sworn in as the governor of Osun state. Naija News reports that Adeleke was sworn in by the Osun State Chief Judge, Adepele Ojo, at the Osogbo City Stadium on Sunday. The former lawmaker came into the venue at about 11:20am and completed taken his oath at about 11:50am. Thereafter, his deputy, Kola Adewusi, also took the oath of office and allegiance which was administered by the chief judge.

item.title: Air Force Officer Arrested Over Nigerian Defence Academy Attack
item.description: Security operatives on Monday arrested Nigerian Air Force officer, Sergeant Torsobo Solomon over with the recent attack on the Nigerian Defence Academy (NDA), Kaduna. Naija News recalls that bandit terrorists had on August 24 attacked the NDA killing two officers and abducting another who was later released. The suspect boarding a plane The officer who was arrested in Yola, Adamawa state capital is currently attached to the Air Force Comprehensive School, Yola.

item.title: Akeredolu Reveals Language Kidnappers In Ondo Forest Speak
item.description: Governor Rotimi Akeredolu of Ondo State has alleged that criminals engaging in kidnapping in the state forest reserves speak Fulfulde. According to UNESCO Thesaurus, Fulfulde is the language of the Fulbe people also known as Peul or Fulani, who are found throughout West Africa. Speaking during an interview with Channels TV on Monday night, the Ondo governor stated that some criminals were using the forest reserves to perpetrate crimes, hence, the quit notice to Fulani herdsmen.

item.title: Andrea Joyce - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: Sportscaster covering Olympic games, college tournaments, tennis championships and NBA playoffs. Before Fame She studied speech and communications at the University of Michigan. Trivia She started off her career covering the 1988 Summer Olympics for ESPN. Family Life She married reporter Harry Smith in 1983. item.title: Bill Nye Dubunks the Idea of Biological Races in One Viral TikTok Video
item.description: Bill Nye Debunks the Idea of Different "Races" — "We're All One Species"By Robin ZlotnickUpdated June 17 2023, 9:21 a.m. ET Source: TikTokBill Nye, everyone's favorite TV scientist, has recently taken to TikTok to give us bite-sized but extremely important lessons about the way the world works. In one, he demonstrated how useful face masks are for reducing the spread of germs. And now, he's debunking the idea of different biological races of humans using one simple device: a map.

item.title: Bola Tinubu Allegedly Undergoes Surgery In US, Back To UK On Crutches
item.description: The National Leader of the All Progressives Congress (APC), Bola Ahmed Tinubu has allegedly undergone another knee surgery at the John Hopkins University Hospital in Maryland, the United States. It was gathered that the former Lagos State Governor returned to the United Kingdom on crutches after undergoing the successful surgery. According to SaharaReporters, sources revealed that the 2023 presidential hopeful wanted the surgery in Paris, France but changed his plan over rumour of his death.

item.title: Brie and Nikki Bella Are Doubling Down on Love as the Hosts of 'Twin Love' (EXCLUSIVE)
item.description: When it comes to finding love as a twin, Nikki and Brie Bella are experts. Now they're helping other twins in Amazon's reality dating show Twin Love. Source: Getty ImagesBrie Bella and Nikki Bella attend the 2023 Rolling Stone Super Bowl Party The Gist: Nikki and Brie Bella are hosts of the reality dating show Twin Love.Despite being identical twins, Nikki and Brie have never been attracted to the same type of guy.

item.title: Christian Bale - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: Played Batman in Christopher Nolan's Dark Knight trilogy and earned critical acclaim for his roles in American Psycho, The Machinist, American Hustle, and The Fighter, the latter of which earned him an Academy Award for Best Supporting Actor.  Before Fame He made his film debut in the 1986 TV film Anastasia: The Mystery of Anna. His performance in the 1987 film Empire of the Sun earned him Best Performance by a Juvenile Actor from the National Board of Review of Motion Pictures.

item.title: Daddy Freeze Speaks After Fatoyinbo Asks Congregants Not To Listen To Nonentities Telling Them Not T
item.description: Popular Nigerian OAP, Daddy Freeze has responded to Biodun Fatoyinbo preachings on paying tithes. Recall that Naija News had earlier reported that Fatoyinbo asked his congregants not to listen to those who were asking them not to pay tithe because rich people like Elon Musk do not pay tithe. He stated that a child of God has a covenant with God therefore the required ten percent must be given. Reacting to Fatoyinbo claims,  Daddy Freeze asked the clergyman if he would be up for a debate based on scriptural backings.

Eniola Badmus Mourns Late Mum On Valentine's Day
item.description: Nollywood actress, Eniola Badmus has taken to Instagram to mourn her mother, today, Valentine’s day. According to the 44 year old, it has been 18 years since she lost her mum and she misses her deeply. The plus-size actress also shared a photo of her mother, disclosing that each time she remembers her mum, she can’t help but cry. Read all she wrote below; “18YEARS WITHOUT A MUM……. You taught me to be strong.

item.title: Is the CW's 'The Republic of Sarah' Based on a True Story?
item.description: 'The Republic of Sarah' Tells a Fictional Tale of a MicronationBy Sara BelcherPublished June 14 2021, 9:15 p.m. ET Source: The CWThe CW's newest drama show, The Republic of Sarah, has a concept that sounds both wild and potentially true. A small town in New Hampshire discovers it holds access to a vein of coltan, a very valuable mineral, only for the state to make plans to wipe the town off the map to capitalize on the finding.

item.title: Msichana wa miaka 18 akamatwa kwenye kisa cha kumteka nyara mama na mwanawe
item.description: - Msichana wa miaka 18 alipatikana kuwa mmoja wa genge hatari kaunti ya SIaya ambapo polisi wanaamini limekuwa likihusika na utekaji nyara - Kipusa huo ni miongoni mwa washukiwa watano ambao wako kizuizini baada ya kumteka nyara mama na mwanawe - Mama huyo na mwanawe walitekwa nyara Novemba 2 na makachero walifaulu kuwaokoa Novemba 10 Msichana wa miaka 18 ni miongoni mwa washukiwa watano ambao wametiwa mbaroni na makachero wa DCI kwenye kisa cha kumteka nyara mama na mwanawe.

item.title: NNPC To Establish More Mega Stations
item.description: Emmanuel Ibe kachikwu, the minister of state for Petroleum said that the federal government was working out plans for the Nigeria National petroleum Corporation (NNPC)to establish more mega petrol stations. He made this known at a news conference in Abuja, The Nation reports. The minister did not, however, disclose the number of stations that the government is planning to build saying: “Definitely, there are many fillings stations we were trying to develop working with the governors in terms of land, local government areas.

item.title: Olivia Neill - Age, Family, Bio
Price Of Bag Of Rice Across States In Nigeria
item.description: In recent times, Nigeria has witnessed a dramatic surge in the prices of commodities, particularly food items, causing widespread concern among its citizens. Market surveys and interactions with vendors across various states reveal a sharp increase in the cost of essential foodstuffs, with the price of a bag of rice, a staple in Nigerian diets, escalating from fifty thousand Naira to over seventy thousand Naira. This significant hike in food prices has become a pressing issue for the average Nigerian, making it increasingly difficult for many to afford basic meals.

item.title: See How Much Nigeria Earned From Non-oil Commodities In 2014
item.description: According to the Nigerian Export Promotion Council (NEPC) data, Nigeria earned a total sum of $2.4bn from the exportation of cocoa, rubber, and other non-oil commodities within the 2014 fiscal period. The NEPC estimates show that cocoa exports with a total amount of $666.45m accounted for the highest non-oil export earnings, followed by raw hides, skins and leather with $487.97m. Oil seeds, grains and plant/straw - $389.78m; aluminium, $113.35m; tobacco, $109.05m; tins, $96.32m; edible fruits and nuts, $75.

item.title: Si Robertson bio: age, net worth, wife, children, military career
item.description: Si Robertson is an American-born television personality. Apart from being a family man, he is also a retired duck-call maker, retired soldier, hunter, outdoorsman, and preacher. He has featured in several shows and has gained lots of fame. Si is best known for his role on Duck Dynasty, where he emerged as a breakout cast member. He also appeared on other shows such as Buck Commander and The Duckmen of Louisiana.

item.title: TikTok Sticker Goes Viral on the Platform
item.description: New Viral Sticker Trend "What Did COVID Do to You?" Is Taking Over TikTokBy Gabrielle BernardiniPublished Nov. 11 2020, 1:00 p.m. ET Source: TikTok/istockMany people would argue that 2020 has been... terrible. Earlier this year, the world was hit with the coronavirus (also known as COVID-19) pandemic, which has affected millions of people. To pass the long days of being stuck inside for months while under a mandated quarantine, many Americans turned to TikTok to be their source of entertainment.

item.title: What Is Known About Emily Lee's Injury? Updates on the Olympic Gymnast
item.description: Emily Lee Worked Tirelessly to Get to the Olympic Trials — and Then Tragedy StruckBy Chris BarillaUpdated July 1 2021, 12:05 p.m. ET Source: InstagramGoing into the 2020 Tokyo Olympic Trials, one of the most promising standout stars was undoubtedly Emily Lee. The UCLA-commit has been wowing the gymnastics world with her prowess on the mats for a few years now, and she had finally achieved the pedigree and support to make a bid at the world's biggest sports stage.
